text: In Greek mythology, the Spercheides, also known as the Maliades, were naiads of the Spercheus River, in Malis. They were sometimes held to be the daughters of the river god Spercheus and the naiad Deino, although Antoninus Liberalis reported the tradition that Cerambus was punished for making this claim.Antoninus Liberalis, Metamorphoses, 32 == References == Category:Naiads Category:Nymphs Category:Greek legendary creatures
title: Spercheides
